runs.comm: outside off stump and left well alone
slashed through point, but a tidy diving stop intercepts the boundary
no messing around from Hayden. Vaas overstepped as well, but that had no impact on the shot. A monstrous mow through midwicket off a good length
outside leg and Hayden takes a big swing, but doesn't quite capitalise
on a good length outside off stump, pushed into the covers
on the spot again, Hayden plays sensibly and straight, and cover cleans up
slightly fuller and drifting onto the pads, clipped firmly up to mid-on, and a jogged single.
outside off stump, shaping away from the left-hander. Left alone
banged in and pulled round the corner to short backward square
slightly leg-sided again, tucked around the corner again
pitched up, in the blockhole, on middle-and-off. Driven straight, and Fernando stoops to intercept
somehow, the leg-stump line is proving very effective in this over. This time, backward square can't stop the single
tidy finish to the over. Australia aren't rushing their run-chase, and why should they?
driven impeccably straight - so straight that it rebounds off the non-striker's stumps and away to long-off
lofted drive, just out of the reach of Malinga at mid-off. But real power behind a stroke that looked a little chancy at first
whipped off middle-and-off to backward square. The batsmen jog back for two
Vaas is also targeting leg stump, and Hayden is happy to pluck another single to deep square
too straight this time, and that's clobbered up and over, and trickles away to the long-on boundary
attempted leg-stump yorker, clangs off the pad and away to slip. Australia chugging along nicely
swish and a miss, outside off stump and short enough to pull, but Hayden can't make contact. Sangakkara is so surprised at the let-off that he fumbles the ball
thumped out to point
just back of a length, Gilchrist steps back and across and nudges into the leg-side for another single
tucked up by that leg-stump line again. No danger of a dismissal though
short and climbing sharply outside off stump. Left well alone with a vertical bat
another uncharacteristic fumble from Sangakkara. A nasty bounce, and a slower ball as well, but hardly an excuse
a smidgeon of width, and Gilchrist flails an attempted cover drive - it loops over the infield and plugs at point, ten yards in from the rope. A bit chancy that time
short and pulled, so quickly into position and it whistles away. Hardly any margin for error
fuller and straighter, and drilled down to long-off
smeared through midwicket. A step and a shimmy, and a massive swing of the blade. Hayden at his bullying best
fuller length, almost yorker-length, swinging away and dug out to point
another attempted yorker, but this time it comes out as a low full-toss, and that's mullahed down the ground for the straightest and sweetest four of the innings
full and outside off, steered down to gully
full and leg-stump line again, clipped to midwicket
shorter, but still on that leg-stump line. Tucked to midwicket with a slight hop
a modicum of width, and Gilchrist leathers that through the gap in the covers, off the back foot. Cracking shot, and Australia are halfway there
tucked off the toes with a flourish, Fernando was aiming for the blockhole but got it ever so slightly wrong
better line and length, straight and sharp, and just back of a length. Defended stoutly off the back foot
good length and tight line, Hayden steps away to make room, but can't get more than a single
Gilchrist returns the compliment
thwacked, and some. Hayden steps away a fraction and launches that over long-off. Superb power
hopeless delivery, short and utterly misdirected. Sangakkara had no chance of cutting that off as it fizzed down the leg side
too short, and swung away into the deep. Fielded on the bounce just inside the midwicket rope
angled into the pads and clipped away. This is rather a procession now
that completes a grim over for Maharoof. That ball was just floated into Hayden's zone, and vanished through long-off with a massive swing of the blade
on the spot first up, pushed cautiously down the ground
a fraction of turn off a good length, and driven coolly to cover
misdirected, down the leg side, well taken by Sangakkara
cut into the covers, and well intercepted
very well bowled, and the brakes have been applied for the moment. Right on the spot
full length, pushed into the gap
strays onto leg stump, and flicked away. But well bowled by Dilshan. Australia are made to wait for their victory
on a good length straight away, Hayden pushes into the covers
banged in but arrow-straight. Gilchrist hops back and nurdles down to third man
attempted yorker, Hayden clips to midwicket
how on earth did he pull that off? That was a full-length off-stump delivery, almost a yorker, and yet Hayden picked it up and over long-on! Remarkable
more conventional this time, clipped out to deep midwicket
pushed into the covers to complete another productive over for the Australians
strays onto the legs - or was it deliberate? Either way, another nudged single
clipped down to fine leg again. All too easy
a rarety - a swing and a miss. Hayden is sizing up a quick kill now
on the spot and driven hard into the covers. No way through just yet though
thumped this time, with a free swing of the arms. That's pure muscle and deep cover had no chance
finds the gap on the leg side, and that's Hayden's half-century - his third of the campaign. There's no stopping the ICC World One-Day Player of the Year
tucked down to third man with a shimmy at the crease - as if he was in ten minds
swing, connect, deposit into the long-on stands. That shot was as vast as the victory itself
